title: Ariel Winter, 21, talks about spending half of her life on ABC's Modern Family
text:
Ariel Winter opened up about spending half her life on ABC's hit sitcom Modern Family on Ellen.

The 21 year old actress spoke appeared on the hit daytime talk show, airing on Thursday, where she spoke with guest host Stephen 'tWitch' Boss.

Winter was just 11 years old when she was cast as Alex Dunphy on Modern Family, opening up about growing up on the show.

Opening up: Ariel Winter opened up about spending half her life on ABC's hit sitcom Modern Family on Ellen

'It's been like half my life,' Winter said. 'I'll be 22 when we end the show next year. Honestly, it's so amazing to have a job like this with people that you love for 11 years that you love. The amount of grateful that we all are is ridiculous.'

She was also very happy to add 'a lot of babies' to the cast this season, adding, 'we had three sets of babies the other day and I love babies,' referring to the twins her on-screen sister Haley (Sarah Hyland) delivered this season.

'I was in the scene with the babies and I was so excited and I was wheeling them in the stroller and, of course, the one day, all three sets of babies didn't want me,' she said.

Half her life: 'It's been like half my life,' Winter said. 'I'll be 22 when we end the show next year. Honestly, it's so amazing to have a job like this with people that you love for 11 years that you love. The amount of grateful that we all are is ridiculous'

'I had to push the stroller with dolls, which is not quite as cute... and kind of creepy. But we have so many babies this season it's super cool,' she added.

Modern Family has always had special Halloween episodes, since the holiday is a big deal with the Dunphy family, but Winter still can't get over being put in a cage in the first season.

'I spent the entire Halloween episode in that cage. I was honestly kind of upset, because everyone was not in the cage, having a good time,' Winter said.

Caged Halloween: Modern Family has always had special Halloween episodes, since the holiday is a big deal with the Dunphy family, but Winter still can't get over being put in a cage in the first season

She also spoke about her four dogs, 'two big dogs, one medium sized dog and one small dog,' who she called her 'babies,' who also hog the covers.

When asked how many of those four dogs sleep in bed with her, she said there were three who sleep with her, one of whom wouldn't give up the covers.

'I had to fight one of my dogs last night for the covers, and it's sad because she made herself dead weight to not give me the covers,' she said.

Ariel's dogs: She also spoke about her four dogs, 'two big dogs, one medium sized dog and one small dog,' who she called her 'babies,' who also hog the covers

tWitch actually guest starred on Modern Family in 2018, revealing that he loved the 'energy' on the set before asking Winter about the final season that is currently airing.

'It's sad, obviously,' Winter said. 'It's not something that we want. We love each other, we love our show. Obviously we would love to make many more, but it's been 11 years and I think everyone is ready to do new things.'

Modern Family continues its 11th and final season on Wednesday nights at 9 PM ET on ABC.
description: Ariel Winter opened up about spending half her life on ABC's hit sitcom Modern Family on Ellen.
